doc.after: The church has been likened to examples of religious architecture from the late Roman Early Christian period the Caucasus and the Carolingian Pre Romanesque of Charlemagne because of its characteristic plan which is significantly different from contemporaneous Bulgarian or Byzantine buildings The church s alternative name the Golden Church stems from its possible and popular identification with a new golden church in Preslav referenced in a medieval literary source The Round Church s rich interior decoration which makes ample use of mosaics ceramics and marble details distinguishes it from other churches in Preslav Its interior features hundreds of drawings depicting ships fauna and Christian figures Medieval inscriptions on the walls range from names of saints in Byzantine Greek to separate letters and short texts in the Glagolitic and Cyrillic alphabets
